intro: Octomeria erosilabia, commonly known as the velvetleaf octomeria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
